intro: Pourouma scabra, commonly known as the balsa tree, is a member of the Poaceae family and is native to South America. It is a tall, slender grass-like plant that can grow up to 10 meters in height. The plant is characterized by its pachycaul stem, which is thick and woody, and its long, narrow leaves. Its inflorescence consists of dense clusters of small, spike-like flowers. The plant is well adapted to tropical climates and is often found in wetland or swampy areas.
